author: yasterisk
content: I'm validating on mainnet and trying to get ready for the merge on kiln....Running geth+lighthouse on kiln (set up according to https://github.com/remyroy/ethstaker/blob/main/merge-devnet.md) and everything looks totally reasonable, except that the beacon chain is 5000 slots ahead of geth (see images which were taken at the same moment...  also , geth is correct according to https://explorer.kiln.themerge.dev/). I should definitely note that I'm using a very sad old macbook air with 4GB RAM, but according to htop there seems to be some space both with memory and processing power.  So is this a processing power issue or there some other reason that the beacon is running so far ahead of the execution layer?

author: ajsutton
content: The consensus layer and execution layer aren't expected to have the same block number.  They started out different when the two chains merged and the beacon chain counts slots (including those without blocks) and the execution layer only counts blocks so they will actually diverge further over time.

author: yasterisk
content: <@340345049063882753> Ah, got it.... Never thought that through. Thank you.
